text: Euthemis is a genus of plant in the family Ochnaceae. The generic name is from the Greek meaning "good law", referring to the even thickness and symmetry of the leaves. ==Description== Euthemis species grow as shrubs. The flowers are white or pink. The fruits form as berries. ==Distribution and habitat== Euthemis species grow naturally in Cambodia, Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia and Borneo. Their habitat is kerangas and peat swamp forests from sea-level to altitude. ==Species== The Plant List recognises 2 accepted species: * Euthemis leucocarpa * Euthemis minor ==References== Category:Ochnaceae Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Malpighiales genera
title: Euthemis
